skills.name: Find missing angles on parallel lines using corresponding angles
Find missing angles on parallel lines using supplementary angles

explanations.A: Alternate angles make a 'z' shape, so this is alternate
explanations.B: Corresponding angles make an 'F' shape. What is the name of the angles that make a 'Z' shape?
explanations.C: Co-interior angles make a 'C' shape. What are angles that make this 'Z' shape called?
explanations.D: The lines are parallel, but the angles make a 'Z' shape. What are these called?

explanations.D: The lines are parallel, but the angles make a 'Z' shape. What are these called?

explanations.B: Corresponding angles make an 'F' shape, so these are corresponding
explanations.C: Co-interior angles make a 'C' shape. What are angles that make this 'F' shape called?
explanations.D: The lines are parallel, but the angles make an 'F' shape. What are these called?

explanations.A: Alternate angles make a 'z' shape, what do we call angles that make this 'C' shape?
explanations.B: Corresponding angles make an 'F' shape. What is the name of the angles that make a 'C' shape?
explanations.C: Co-interior angles make a 'C' shape, so these angles are co-interior
explanations.D: The lines are parallel, but the angles make a 'C' shape. What are these called?

explanations.A: Alternate angles make a 'z' shape, what do we call angles that make this 'C' shape?
explanations.B: Co-interior angles make a 'C' shape, so these angles are co-interior
explanations.C: Corresponding angles make an 'F' shape. What is the name of the angles that make a 'C' shape?

explanations.A: These angles are corresponding as they make an 'F' shape. Corresponding angles are equal so the missing angle is 70⁰.
explanations.B: I think you have subtracted 70 from 180 to get the missing angle. These angles make an 'F' shape so are corresponding. What must this angle be?
explanations.C: I think you have subtracted 70 from 360 to get the missing angle. These angles make an 'F' shape so are corresponding. What must this angle be?
explanations.D: I think you have subtracted 2 lots of 70 from 360 to get the missing angle. These angles make an 'F' shape so are corresponding. What must this angle be?

explanations.A: I think you have subtracted 65 from 180 to get the missing angle. These angles make an 'F' shape so are corresponding. What must this angle be?
explanations.B: These angles are corresponding as they make an 'F' shape. Corresponding angles are equal so the missing angle is 65⁰.
explanations.C: I think you have tried to subtract 65 from 180 to get the missing angle. These angles make an 'F' shape so are corresponding. What must this angle be?
explanations.D: I think you have subtracted 65 from 360 to get the missing angle. These angles make an 'F' shape so are corresponding. What must this angle be?

explanations.A: I think you thought the angles were the same. These angles are co-interior, what relationship is there between co-interior angles?
explanations.B: The angles are co-interior, which means they add up to 180. 180 - 58 = 122, so 122⁰ is the missing angle
explanations.D: I think you have subtracted 58 from 360 to find the missing angle. Remember co-interior angles add up to 180⁰.

explanations.A: The angles are co-interior, which means they add up to 180. 180 - 78 = 102, so 172⁰ is the missing angle
explanations.B: I think you thought the angles were the same. These angles are co-interior, what relationship is there between co-interior angles?
explanations.C: I think you have subtracted 78 from 360 to find the missing angle. Remember co-interior angles add up to 180⁰.
